content: opening this topic to continue the discussion that is happening during the weekly meeting here
my main question here is what should we take care of, would that be backports? what about p-critical issues? regressions? nominations?
I think this needs feedback from rustdoc team
Here is my dialogue with imperio from yesterday: image.png
one detail I overlooked yesterday was that they are using the monthly dev-tools meeting as a "fixed point" (which I take to mean "synchronization point")
I don't know how much of the stuff @Santiago Pastorino listed is handled at that time
but I take the fact that the beta-nomination here went unhandled for so long as a sign that it really is something we should take care of
imperio sounded positive about us checking in on regressions and beta-backports
ok, so I guess we should include stable-nonimations, beta-nominations and P-high regression-from-stable-to-X, is that right @pnkfelix ?
Not sure about P-high
But the other three, yes
(If we aren’t assigning/controlling the priority labels, then I don’t want us in charge of visiting them)
I meant ["P-high", "regression-from-stable-to-X"] (high priority regressions) not just P-high, neither P-medium or P-low regressions
but unsure :), maybe all regressions?
oh I see
so then my worry would be whether the regressions are being marked with the P-labels
maybe the way to go is regression-from-stable-to-X && (P-high || P-label missing)
We are currently trying to prioritize all regressions
okay then
And the I-prioritize label is now automatically added to unprioritized regressions
So theoretically no regression should stay unprioritized in the future
exactly :)
so, ok, I think we've reached an agreement to consider from T-rustdoc, stable-nonimations, beta-nominations and (P-high && regression-from-stable-to-*)
